Blurb:

With the explosion of advancement in space flight, space tourism is now a viable business opportunity. I have received planning permission for a large hotel on the surface of the Mun. Now I must call upon you, the various space agencies of Kerbin to provide me with cheapest possible flights to and from my new hotel.

Challenge Over View:

Land any number of Kerbal passengers on the Mun for the Cheapest Cost per Kerbal.

Challenge Rules:

Must Launch from the KSC (can be the launch pad or the runway)

Must Land anywhere on the surface of the Mun

Must get all the Kerbals out and take a holiday photo with your ship in the background

Must return with all Kerbals Alive to anywhere on Kerbin

Every flight must have at least 1 pilot who is not counted as a passenger (an Orange Suite)

Must be completed in a single launch and No using any craft that wasnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t launched at the same time as your passengers (for LKO Refuel for example)

The exception to this rule is a "passenger bus" if your using command seats for the passengers

This must be completed in career mode to get a recovery value. (You were all complaining there was too much money, so start spending!)

Game Rules:

Vanilla KSP

0.24 Original Parts only

No exploits Ã¢â‚¬â€œ Im not going to ban control surfaces or anything so this is based on honour

No Parts of Physics mods Ã¢â‚¬â€œ I want people to be able to recreate your method on a fresh 0.24 install

Information readouts and Auto pilots are allowed as long as they donÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t provide additional flight capability

If you are unsure feel free to ask if a part/mod is allowable.

Challenge Scoring:

Score = (VABCost - RecoveryValue) / KerbalPassengers

Lowest Score Wins

Brownie Points:

If you fancy making this more challenging try some of these additional ideas. (no effect on scoring)

Take your holiday photo with an Easter egg or Kerbin in the background

Build a Ã¢â‚¬Å“hotelÃ¢â‚¬Â for your passengers to stay in

Let your passengers out for spacewalk on route.

Scores update

So here is my Example Run. A very simple 4 stage rocket iv been using to gather science and complete contracts around the mun. I know the delta V is about right for a mun run. Now I'm only half way though the career so my ship is a bit of a botch of mismatched parts at the moment but its a simple example to get us going.

As you can see its a bit of a mess but it works for now.

This ship came in at Ã‚Â£110,490 which seems a lot more expensive than my usual ships.

I had Good Ol Jeb as my Pilot for this mission, Carrying 4 passengers.

A VERY steady launch for a change. usually I get on odd wobble.

The orbital manoeuvres were nothing special so here is the "Holiday Snap"

Finally arriving back on Kerbin

It was actually one of my most successful missions. very little drama so the full crew are now back.

The craft wasn't worth much by the time id finished only Ã‚Â£12,012.41

So for my example run my Score is Calculated as follows:

(110490-12012.41)/4=Ã‚Â£24,619 Per Kerbal!

I can see this going in 2 directions. A modified SSTO taking a few kerbals at a time just for fuel costs. Or a Jumbo Rocket with tons of kerbals to get the economies of scale.
